subject: Swimming
lead_paragraph: Five more world records were set on the third day of the short-course world championships in Manchester, England, raising the total to nine. Ryan Lochte of the United States set his second record of the meet in taking the men’s 200 individual medley. The United States’ Margaret Hoelzer, Jessica Hardy, Rachel Komisarz and Kara Denby had the final record of the day, in the women’s 4x100 medley relay.
